subscription_alternative.monthly_limit: Up to 80 messages per 3 hours on GPT-4o; unlimited on GPT-4o mini
5x more usage than free tier, with access to models including Claude 3.5 Sonnet
Usage is pooled across all Claude models available to the subscriber
Access via gemini.google.com, uses Gemini 1.5 Pro model. No strict token limit, but usage monitoring for abuse applies.
This is the model powering the Gemini Advanced subscription

details.cost_structure: Free to use and modify. Commercial use free for services with < 700M monthly active users. Larger scale requires a special license from Meta.
details.hosting_costs: Users pay for their own compute infrastructure (e.g., AWS, GCP, Azure, or on-premise). Cloud providers offer per-token rates that vary widely.

copilot_pro.includes: Access to Copilot in Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook, OneNote, priority access to latest models like GPT-4 Turbo

microsoft_365_copilot.includes: All Copilot Pro features plus enterprise-grade data protection, Microsoft Graph integration, and Teams meeting capabilities

pricing_analysis.subscription_adoption_rate: Officially undisclosed; high adoption among individual prosumers and rapid growth in enterprise sector
pricing_analysis.trend: Aggressive price compression among top-tier models (e.g., GPT-4o vs GPT-4 Turbo). The market is shifting towards a 'race to the bottom' on token costs while simultaneously increasing model capability, making powerful AI more accessible. Subscription models remain the primary consumer-facing strategy.
